page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: There are two forts in Efford, Plymouth, which are connected by a lane called Military Road. These forts are part of the North East defence line of forts built to defend Plymouth in the 1860s from a landward attack. Laira Battery - the fort nearest the River Plym - and Efford Fort - the next in line - were designed to have 15 cannon and 5 mortars, but they were never manned nor munitioned. Thus they are known as Palmerston's Follies, as they were built, at a cost of about 10,000 pounds, on the orders of Lord Palmerston, the then Prime Minister. Laira Battery is now used as a scrap store, and Efford Fort is the winter quarters of the Showman's Guild, where fairground people can store their shows and live in the winter. They are both Ancient Monuments.
